intro: Isodendrion molokaiense, commonly known as the Molokai sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and stream banks. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
